FuncDef: The display ipv6 routing-table command displays information about an IPv6 routing table. The display ipv6 routing-table command displays information about an IPv6 routing table. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display ipv6 routing-table [ table-namemsr ] { <ipv6-address> [ <prefix-length> ] | host-name <host-name> } [ longer-match ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Table to which a producer belongs.
-

Specifies the IPv6 destination address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the length of an IPv6 prefix.
It is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

Specifies the hostname.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays the routes that match the specified network or mask only.
-

Displays details about all active and inactive routes in the current routing table.
-

Indicates the multicast static routing table.
-
